title: Chelsea and Claude Makelele 'surprised' by loan star Conor Gallagher
text:
Chelsea’s Conor Gallagher has enjoyed a fantastic start to his loan spell at Charlton (Picture: Getty)

Chelsea and Claude Makelele are ‘delighted’ and ‘surprised’ by the development of loan star Conor Gallagher, according to Charlton boss Lee Bowyer.

Gallagher, 19, has enjoyed a superb start to his loan stint at The Valley, scoring four goals and making one assist for the Championship new-boys.

The teenager’s most recent strike helped the Addicks secure a hard-fought 2-2 draw with Fulham, who were relegated from the Premier League last season.

Gallagher, who was an unused substitute during the 2019 Europa League final, was sent to Charlton to develop his game and Chelsea are ‘delighted’ with his progress.

Addicks manager Lee Bowyer has been impressed by Gallagher (Picture: Getty)

Speaking after Charlton’s draw at Craven Cottage, former Premier League star Bowyer said: ‘Conor isn’t bad… not a bad player!

‘Has he surprised me? He’s scored five goals, one every two games, for a 19-year-old kid who’s never played men’s football before, he’ll surprise anyone.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘I think he’s even surprised Chelsea. I don’t think they knew how far he could go so soon.

‘They had people come in on Thursday. Claude Makelele (technical mentor at Chelsea) came in to speak to us about the loan, how Conor is getting on, their thoughts on him and they’re delighted.

‘Conor is a good player, one to watch in the future.’

During the international break, Gallagher will join up with the England U21 squad after being promoted from the U20s.

The talented midfielder has spoken highly of Charlton boss Bowyer, who led the Addicks to promotion in League One last season.

Chelsea hero Claude Makelele is keeping close tabs on Gallagher (Picture: Getty)

‘He’s great. I’ve only worked under him for a couple of months now but I’ve loved it,’ Gallagher said.

‘He was a midfielder back in the day and knows his stuff. He has played at the top level so it’s a lot to learn to make the box every time and that is how I’ve scored my goals this season.

‘I am looking forward to working under him for the end of the season.’
